Package com.quantimodo.tools.fragments

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DrawerFragment.MenuListener
    Menu interaction listener, should be implemented by hosting activity or target fragment
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DrawerFragment
    Basic drawer fragment, by default renders only Expandable list with DrawerItems Hosting activity or target fragment should implement MenuListener, to handle menu interactions
    FactorsFragment
    Used to show positive/negative factors Should be in init with newInstance(int, String) method Fetch both types of factors same time, so same instance can be used to show positive and negative factors, and can be switched between types by setType(int) method.
    ImportWebFragment  
    QFragment
    Base class for fragments Creates SpiceManager to use RoboSpice
    QListFragment
    Base class for list fragments Creates SpiceManager to use RoboSpice
    QuantimodoWebFragment  
    TrackingFragment
    Used to show/search/submit measurements and variables Require network access and user auth in Quantimodo Search can be narrowed to one category, check newInstance(int) method for more details
    TrackingFragment.CategoryDef
    Category definition, that defines some params of tracking fragment like Action bar title Category name, that would used in search variables request Default value Default unit Hint for search variable edit input Default combine type of new variable There are several predefined CategoryDefs Diet – TrackingFragment.TYPE_DIET Treatments – TrackingFragment.TYPE_TREATMENTS Symptoms – TrackingFragment.TYPE_SYMPTOMS Mood – TrackingFragment.TYPE_MOOD
    WalkthroughPageFragment  
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    TrackingFragment.TrackingType
